name: Minsung Kim
content: Minsung KimSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationMinsung KimI am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and WINLAB at Rutgers University. I am also an Associate Graduate Faculty member in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering. Before joining Rutgers, I was a Postdoctoral Associate at Yale University. I received my Ph.D. in Computer Science from Princeton University, supported by the Siebel Scholars Fellowship and the Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship.At Rutgers CS, I lead EXceL: NextG Wireless and Emerging Computing Systems LaboratoryWe study quantum and emerging computing systems for next-generation wireless networks. The research aims to leverage quantum and quantum-inspired computation to expedite NextG baseband processing at base station systems, which would unlock unprecedented levels of wireless performance in communication networks. I am looking for self-motivated students/postdocs. If you are interested in working with me (for topics on Quantum x Wireless x AI x Systems), feel free to contact me (minsungk.cs@rutgers.edu) with your CV.Email: minsungk.cs@rutgers.edu | Office: CoRE 313 | 96 Frelinghuysen Road, Piscataway, NJ   [Rutgers CoRE][CS Department][WINLAB: Wireless Information Network Laboratory]News[Nov. 2025] delivered a talk on X-ResQ at ACM MobiCom 2025 in Hong Kong[Oct. 2025] serving on TPC for ACM MobiSys 2026 & ACM MobiCom 2026[Jul. 2025] delivering talks in Korea: POSTECH (6/23), KAIST (6/26), Yonsei Univ. (7/2), SNU (7/8), and Korea Univ.
